intro: Jasione amethystina subsp. centralis, commonly known as the central jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and purple-tinged flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers in spring. This subspecies is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler climates.
